title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of race, class, gender, and family set in the Deep South during the 1930s.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society under constant surveillance.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic novel that explores themes of love, class, and reputation in 19th century England.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A story about the jazz age and the American dream, set in 1920s New York.

title: Moby Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: An epic tale of adventure and obsession as Captain Ahab pursues the white whale, Moby Dick.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A historical novel that follows the lives of five aristocratic families during the Napoleonic Wars.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A novel about teenage rebellion and alienation told through the eyes of Holden Caulfield.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A fantasy novel that follows the journey of Bilbo Baggins to win a share of treasure guarded by Smaug the dragon.
